name: Rhonda Rudd
text: I will never go there again!

name: Rachael Chidoni
text: I went to get a Mani/pedi and eyebrow waxing done and was told it would be a 20 minute wait. That was OK until 50 minutes later two women came in after me, one for a pedi and the other for a Mani are both receiving service and I'm still left to wait!!! I have had to wait a bit longer than what I was originally told but not an extra 30 minutes and it is completely unacceptable that not just one but two women who came in long after I did received service before me. I am going to a near by saoln to get what I need done and will never be back. If I'm going to spend $60 on nails and a wax I dont want to be forgotten or ignored!

resp.text: Ms. Bolton, I am so very sorry for what happened during your walk-in first visit on Saturday August 20th. I felt very bad that we did not have an opportunity to provide you the service that you came for. As you could see, we were very busy that day and importantly, Shawn (one of our staff) had a family emergency where he had to unexpectedly take his sick daughter to the emergency room. There were two clients who did come in after you, but received services before you. The reason was that both had appointments at 1:00 PM. One of those clients had an 11:50 AM appointment that morning for a fill-in, but because we were busy then, I asked her to come back at 1:00 PM, and she did. The other lady had days before made an appointment for a pedicure at 1:00 PM. It ended up being a “perfect storm”, being unexpectedly short staffed and super busy at the same time. I hope you understand that we are taking customer service very seriously, not only for our appointment clients that we are obligated to take first, but for our important walk-in clients whom we always try to take care of as soon as possible too. It was completely my fault that I did not tell you that these two ladies had existing appointments, and I am so sorry that I did not explain. I hope you will give our salon another chance, because we are truly value your business. If you will give us another chance, we will endeavor to make it a wonderful experience for you. Again, I and Beyond Nail Spa extend our most sincere apologies.

name: Nikki
text: It was horrible ! They over price everything I went in for a fill in with gel polish and it was $28.00 and then a day later my nails start to come up and now my nails are breaking not even a week old ! GO TO LOVELY NAILS THEY ARE THE BEST !

resp.text: Nicole, please know that the shop you visited and reviewed on our Google Business Page is a similarly named shop called Nails Beyond located in Huntsville.  It is not related to our Madison nail shop at all, because our shop charges for Fill-ins with Shellac color is $32 and up, and not $28 as you stated in the review.  Also please know that our shop, BEYOND NAIL SPA (on Hughes Road across from the Insanity Skate Park and near Madison City Hall) stands proudly behind the quality of our work and offers hospital grade sterilization on our of our nail tools for each client, every time.  We warmly invite you to come try our shop.  Please help us to make the correction or remove the review you wrote on our Google business page.  All feedback reviews from clients are so important to us and we take them very seriously.  Best wishes, BEYOND NAIL SPA.

name: Amber Danley
text: Sarah offered to take care of me when I walked in and was told the stylist I was scheduled with no longer works there. She gave amazing customer service and never made me feel like I was a hassle while she took care of me and her appointment at the same time. She did a great job on my hair and I look forward to coming back! Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because I got a call about the stylist being gone an hour after my scheduled time, while I was in the salon already being taken care of. That was too little, too late. But Sarah was wonderful and I'm very happy with my hair!

name: Ashley Huffman
text: First of all..Hannah Davis, you are an absolute angel! I brought my mother here to get her hair done for the second or third time in her entire life. She is a very hard working woman, and missed feeling feminine.  She thought her hair was hopeless. She thought -she- was hopeless. Hannah spent the bulk of her day cutting, dying, styling my mom's hair, and then did her makeup!  For the first time in two or three decades, my mom felt beautiful. Hannah made my mom realize that she can still be as gorgeous as ever. I haven't seen her smile this much in a very long time.  Thank you so much, Hannah, and I can't wait to come back and see what magic you can work with my hair!

name: Brandy Tobias
text: Everyone is very friendly! Another stylist helped take my foils out and blow my hair dry! My stylist was amazing as always and I will be going back! Salon is very clean and well kept! text:
This is the most amazing place with the most amazing lady, Suzanne. My daughter was getting married far from home and you want to  look your best and most of  all, you  want her to shine her brightest on her day. Suzanne was helpful and very calming to myself and my daughter. I have had the same hairdresser for 25 years and was anxious of having it done by a stranger. My hair looked great and she even made time to help me with my makeup.
My daughter had her hair done for her wedding and it was gorgeous and   it looked great thru the entire evening .Did I mention we had a beach wedding. I can't express my gratitude to Suzanne for all her help. Mom, Dad and bride got dressed at her salon. And she helped my daughter get into her bridal gown and put on her jewelry. She went well above and beyond. If anyone is wondering about costs for all this, we compared prices before scheduling appointments and she was very comparative to all others in her field. But we feel she gave us so much more that we paid for and we took a great deal of her time,. Thank you Suzanne

name: Jocelyn Jimerson
text: Kasey did the Worst sew-in I Have EVER seen I would not have thought it was even possible to do this BAD She did my hair on a Friday and the Next Wednesday I was able to remove the entire hot mess of a sew- in with my hands as the threads started falling from my head that Sunday😡😡😡 Contacted the Salon and her and other staff we're very unprofessional about it! I.WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE.

resp.text:
Ms. Jimerson did indeed come in and get a sew in and her extensions were cut and styled as well.She paid a total of $100, a $35 discount for being a new client. When Ms.Jemison left she was satisfied with her service and even allowed after photos. When she called SLB to discuss the issues that she was experiencing , she was told that Kasey would love to take a look at whatever the problem was.In any instance of dissatisfaction we always invite the guest back in as we did in this case. She agreed to return but when she arrived she informed the stylist that she had changed her mind and wanted a refund instead.

The stylist let Ms.Jimerson know that she was not authorized to issue refunds, which she is not, and would escalate this matter to the manager or owner to resolve it further.

Ms. Jimerson refused any further mediation and left disgruntled. She filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau which we are now disputing. At this point, due to her  attempts to discredit our Salon and the unprofessional manner in which she has behaved, we no longer wish to do business with Ms.Jemerson and will not be issuing a refund or a salon credit.

name: Jere Allison
text: This salon is amazing. The staff are very friendly and SKILLED! My hair loves Salon Lisa Brown! I highly recommend this place.

name: Shirley Cox-Glenn
text: I went  to  Salon Lisa Brown about 2 weeks ago.  The staff was very nice and Jamal did my hair with rods.  I love it .  Two weeks later it is still holding.  I love my hair  and he take you at your appointed time. No waiting. Thanks Jamal I will be going back soon.

name: Vanessa Cornelison
text: I was a little anxious about doing a Keratin treatment for my natural hair since I couldn't find a good reference from anyone. I called salon after salon and just didn't feel comfortable paying $400+  to do the treatment just because of my coarser texture. I called Salon Lisa Brown and found not only a reasonable price but an AWESOME stylist (props to Jamal) to tame my mane. He let me know right off the bat that it was formaldehyde free, how things were going to go down and what to expect for aftercare. I was FLOORED once he finished the treatment. I looked like a totally different person and he laid my hair from root to ends, straighter than I've EVER had it!  I will be going back in two weeks to have it properly washed to keep it maintained. Here's my recommendation if you want to take the leap like I did and it come out a success! ( If you're in a salon for "atmosphere" instead of your hair, it's a cool little place ;) but not the Taj Mahal.)

name: Linda Poindexter
text: I absolutely love Salon Lisa Brown services! My hair has grown tremendously and every staff member does a fantastic job! I recommend them to everyone I know, 5 stars!!!

name: Sabrina Ellington
text: Excellent service, not so excellent quality of work. Was mislead into thinking a certain hairstyle could be achieved, and later after starting perming etc, it went to something totally different. It was asked if I was ok with my hair being cut, I agreed because this was the plan I came in with. It went from that to the still couldn’t be achieved because of the density of my hair. Once this was stated, I decided to tell Ms. Lisa, I don’t think we should waste anymore time, and just end it here. It went from that to No, it’s going to be cute. Long story short, I hated my hair, I made this known before I left and Ms. Lisa stated that she thought I would like it better once my curls flatten out, Well... by the time I woke up they were gone. When I expressed how much I didn’t like it, she did say they guarantee their hair do’s and I could come back or scheduled another appt and they would fix it, but obviously, I probably won’t be taking that offer up for obvious reasons, So definitely a waste of money.

name: P Sayasane
text:
I’ve attempted to schedule a four serenity package given to my daughters and I for Christmas. When I called to schedule earlier this year, I was told I would get a call back once they’ve contacted another masseuse to come in that they would need two and they would contact me back. I informed them if they was unable to schedule the four, I would like to schedule at least two. I never received a call back. I contacted them once again to schedule the four packages by leaving a message on the website and by phone on several different occasion. Once I received a response, I was informed they would have someone call me back and nothing. Left a message on the website and phone once again, Response…they didn’t have a masseuse in but once the masseuse returned or another one staffed I would be priority and we would be scheduled. I gave it 2 weeks and nothing. Left a message on the website again and by phone. Response, they would have to call me back when the new owners or previous owner was in.😱😳
With the COVID and lack of staff the owner (which will now be the previous) was kind enough to honor the now expired packages but to this day still haven’t been able to schedule an appointment.

I informed the person that gave us these gift certificates and it’s a disappointment thinking you’ve selected the best and get this type of response, unable to receive the services paid for.

Lesson learned: Gift certificates is NOT a good choice!

name: April Crysel
text: We had a wonderful afternoon at Bliss! They accommodated us as a group and fit us into the schedule perfectly. We all wanted something different ....massages, facials, and pedicures! The services were all great and everyone was very polite & professional. It was a great experience for my sister’s birthday!

resp.text:
Thank you so much.  I appreciate your review.  Being a business owner yourself, I know you understand just how much a 5 star review means.  I hope you guys have a great night.  I look forward to seeing you again!
Tera Shade

text: This spa is amazing! Friendly staff, incredibly hygienic, and every amenity you could ever need. The staff was very knowledgeable and professional. I had an incredible experience there and it is by far the best spot I have been to in Mobile.

resp.text: Thank you Caitlin for the 5 star review.  We all appreciate your taking the time to say such nice things about Bliss.  We hope to see you soon.  Teran Shade

text: Dear Owner, You must not have a very good database. I was there, I spent over $300 for a haircut,  color, & upper last partial fills, I was there for over 7 hours.

resp.text: Wanda, Your name is not is our database. We have kept a database since the day we opened.  There is another company in town with the name Bliss.  I think you must have us confused with this other place. We would love to have you visit us so we have the opportunity  to show you who we are and how we take care of all of our clients.  Please drop by anytime.  Tera Shade

name: Tera Shade
text: In response to the "1 star" review written 3 years ago.  I responded 2 days after it posted but it never showed up, so I'll try again with my response...When this review was first posted the person included her name (it has since been changed to "anonymous").  I called the reviewer and inquired about her time spent at Bliss.  You see, I am the owner and very concerned about our reputation and our guests experience.  I believe the following information will help you decided if you want to take this reviewer seriously.   Let me begin by saying this reviewer called late in the day to make an appointment to have her hair cut.  Even though we were booked until closing time, one of my stylist agreed to stay late and take the appointment.  The two employees behind the desk greeted this reviewer, offered her something to drink, and informed the stylist of her arrival.  Because it was now after closing time, the two front desk employees left for the day.  This reviewer was not left alone or ignored at any time.  The stylist who volunteered to stay late, finished with the client she was with and was on time for this reviewers scheduled appointment.  This reviewer had her hair shampooed, had more of a trim than a cut, and blown out.  She was charged $15.  Her comment about being charged three times what she should have been charged... Well, I don't know where a woman can get her hair shampooed, cut/trimmed, and blown out for $5.  She did say she was new to the area, so maybe she could get the above service done for $5 where ever she moved from...Just to be clear, Bliss does not offer shampoos, haircuts, and styles for $5....  I noticed she did not mention the amount she was charged.   Could it have been she as embarrassed to admit that she thought $15 was "three times more than what it should have been." Because this reviewer posted this review under her name and because we had her phone number on file, I called and inquired about her time at Bliss.  I stated I was the owner and was making follow up calls with our new clients.  I did not  mention I had read her review but instead asked how she enjoyed her visit with us.  I gave her every opportunity to relate any unpleasant experience she might have had.  I was told that Bliss is a beautiful place and was thanked for taking her appointment on such short notice and after hours.  When asked how she like her hair cut even thought it really was only a trim, she responded "I like it, she did a good job." During our conversation, she never said anything negative about her visit at Bliss, and when I invited her to return in the future she said she would.  To be honest, she has not returned .  I wish she had given us another chance so that she could experience what Bliss is really about.  I would also like to respond to the comment about the service being done half-hearted and with no conversation.  The stylist's mother had just passed away very unexpectedly two weeks earlier.  She was still mourning her loss but trying to live as normal as possible and continue to work and support herself.  While this reviewer had no clue what was happening in our stylist personal life, I think because of the comment she made in her review for all to read, its important for you to know why our stylist was not her usual outgoing friendly self.   I am very interested in making each client feel welcome and appreciated.  I personally follow up with as many clients as possible to make sure that their time at Bliss was relaxing and that they are satisfied with their service.  I know this has been a lot to read, but I wanted to give a little more information about the above review.  I am sure I am not the only business owner that is willing to go above and beyond what is normal to make their guest happy.  If something is not what you are expecting, please let us know.  Give us the opportunity to "fix" it.  Our guest are the reason we even have a business and we understand that, without "you" we wouldn't be here.  We look forward to seeing you and making you feel "special" like the person you are!!!

text: I only give 3 stars because of Indya who performed my teeth-whitening.  She was very kind, professional, and personable. The waiting area is a strange experience:  no receptionist; just a couple of soft-spoken men who hand out water.  I would return to see Indya for another non-teeth treatment but wouldn't recommend this spa to anyone.

resp.text: Hi Elizabeth, I am the owner of Bliss Salon & Day Spa.  I read all reviews on my company and need to reply to this one.  You have my company mixed up with some other company.  Bliss does not perform teeth-whitening services, nor do I employee anyone named Indya.  We have never had any men work at Bliss or any men that hand out water. I do not know what spa you went to but it was not Bliss Salon & Day Spa on Old Shell Road in Mobile, AL.  I try very hard to make Bliss a great experience for every client and would appreciate your correcting the review so that it does not affect my company.  Thank you very much.  Tera

name: Angela Blackmon
text: DO NOT BOOK AN APPOINTMENT ONLINE OR THE APP. I BOOKED AN APPOINTMENT DAYS AGO. GOT A CONFIRMATION SAYING IT WAS GOOD. THE DAY BEFORE MY APPOINTMENT SAID IT WAS REMINDING ME OF MY APPOINTMENT SAID PLEASE CLICK HERE TO CANCEL. COME TO MY APPOINTMENT AND THE MANAGER SAID I GOT AN EMAIL SAYING IT WAS UNSUCCESSFUL. ONLY AN HOUR BEFORE MY APPOINTMENT. SHE TOLD ME THAT IF I HAD BOOKED OVER THE PHONE OR IN THE STORE IT WOULD HAVE BEEN ON THE SCHEDULE. BOOKING ONLINE OR APP YOU CAN GET BUMPED OFF THE SCHEDULE IF SOMEONE CALLS IN OR COMES IN TO SCHEDULE. WHAT A LOAD OF LAZY BS! IF SOMEONE BOOKS AN APPOINTMENT AND DOESN'T CALL TO CANCEL OR GET A CALL LETTING THEM KNOW ITS NOT BOOKED THEY WILL EXPECT GO BE ABLE TO COME TO THE FREAKING APPOINTMENT THEY MADE! NO ONE SHOULD GET BUMPED BECAUSE THEY WERE UNABLE TO CALL OR GO IN PERSONALLY. PEOPLE DO WORK AND ARE NOT ABLE TO PHYSICALLY GO IN PERSON OR CALL ON THE PHONE. IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO HONOR AN ONLINE BOOKING THEN DO NOT HAVE IT ON YOUR FREAKING WEBSITE! THEN HAVE THE AUDACITY TO SAY YOU CAN COME IN TO BOOK AN APPOINTMENT TOMORROW. NOPE! I JUST BOOKED WITH A 5 STAR REVIEW PLACE SAME DAY TODAY! I USED TO LOVE THIS PLACE BUT THEY HAVE LOST MY BUSINESS AND I AM TELLING EVERYONE I KNOW ABOUT THIS! CALL ME A KAREN OR WHATEVER BUT THAT IS NOT PROFESSIONAL!

name: Khyla Bodie
text: Thick hair beware- I took my mom to this salon as a special treat for her birthday. It had been years since she had been treated to a girls day and so today was a special girls day where we could get our hair cut together. We live in Florida and wanted to spend some time in Dothan visiting our favorite shops. We booked an appointment and scheduled our day around town. My mom was so excited when she sat down and explained what she wanted. Instantly the stylist scowled and said "I'm gonna let you know now... your hair is not going to do that"  My mom has had this particular cut before and explained that it was okay and that she wanted this cut. The stylist did not wash her hair at all before tearing into it with scissors. The entire appointment the stylist complained that he hair was "too thick" and did not stop complaining about how my moms hair "just wouldn't cooperate." At the end of the appointment, my mom did not receive the cut she wanted at all, it was a jagged uneven cut. My mom had beautiful long hair and now the cut was so short that even if she wanted to have it fixed at another salon, it would turn into a pixie which is NOT what she wanted. For me, thankfully she didn't botch my hair like my mom but still she was rude and complained that my hair was "just as thick as my moms" I already have a pixie so there wasn't much she could mess up on thank God. At checkout, the stylist even scowled at the fact that i was paying for my moms cut along with my own! as if its unheard of for a daughter to treat her mother on her birthday! Needles to say I left a small tip to be nice because the cuts were not that expensive but honestly i shouldn't have. My mom was so upset that night when we went to dinner and did not feel confident :(

name: Daniel Stokes
text: This place is horrible. I made an online appointment friday for 10:15 on saturday. Got there early and waited till 10:10 to go to the door. When i got there she said I was not on the schedule and that the online service double books and they have to cancel the overbooked. She said i would have gotten an email about the cancelation, but i never got one. They are cancelling people and only taking the ones they want.

name: Faith Perry
text: I got my hair cut here today and I absolutely love it. Just upset with what I had to pay. When I called and went in I said both times that I just wanted an adult hair cut. After cutting, she said she needed to completely dry my hair to make sure it was all cut right. I said that was fine and she used a blow dryer to dry it. When I went to check out she charged me 15.99 for the hair cut and then 17.99 for "styling" my hair. I asked what that was for since I only wanted a hair cut and she said for blow drying my hair. I didnt understand why blow drying my hair was more than the hair cut itself and I was upset that she didn't tell me it would cost to blow dry my hair. Still very happy with how my hair looks. I am just upset with how a service was done and charged without telling me first because I would have said to not dry it.

text: They cut my sons hair and it always looks nice but every single time we have ever been we have to wait. Usually an hour or so. One time 2 hours. And it's not like they are slammed. The stylists take forever to cut your hair. Also one time the lady mispronounced my sons name, Micah, she said Makiya. I wasn't paying attention, I just know I never heard Micah.  We were skipped and had to wait even longer.

name: Tamara Stinson
text: Rochelle is amazing with my boys! They love coming to get their hair cut & having her style it for them.

name: Dayzohnuh McMiller
text: I am a frequent customer and Mrs.Roshelle does my hair all the time and I love how patient she is and how she takes her time with her work!

name: Billy Dease
text: If you want the best haircut in town, then Cost Cutters of Dothan Alabama is the place to be..

name: Edith Berglund
text: Great with children and they make your hair look amazing

name: Kats positively world Kat
text: Mrs. Rochelle is a hair goddess . I come to her for all my hair needs . Such a fun filled  environment I bring my whole family . Thanks love !

name: PC Firearms
text:
Showed up at this place as a walk-in Sunday afternoon and not a single person in the store for a simple shaved haircut. the lady helping me answered the phone while she is conversing with me and promptly penciled someone in for 45 minutes ahead. Then told me I would have to wait 30 minutes for the next stylist to come off break because she wouldn’t have time to finish before the call in arrived. Left very dissatisfied.
Fast forward to the next day Monday . I get there at 6:15 and the stylist is finishing up a haircut with no one else in line and told that she was closing up for the rest of the night when their posted hours state they are open until 7pm.

I definitely can’t comment on the quality of their haircuts because it seems you have to call 4 days in advance and wait an hour to even get one.
Will definitely  not get another shot at my business ever again.

name: Joel Munoz III
text:
It's hit or miss. Depending on the stylist, you're either going to have a great haircut or a terrible one. The staff can be very friendly or you can walk in and they're rude as heck.

Scenario: i walk in "i was hoping to get my sons hair cut today"
girl looks at me like shes frustrated and says "well, you gonna have to come back"
me" "ok, no problem, is there a specific time?"
her: "yeah, 5:30"
This was 20 mins after opening on a Saturday. Maybe it was too early in the morning to be polite. I wont go back, considering there are TONS of other places people can go for haircuts in this town you would think they wouldn't be rude.

resp.text:
Joel, We're sorry to hear this and thank you for letting us know. We have shared this with our local Guest Services team. We strive to provide a quality salon experience every time you visit.
If you are interested in discussing this with a District Leader, please contact 1-800-345-7811 or departmentcs@regiscorp.com. Thank you.

name: Patricia Smiley
text: I Love  Rochelle.  She always does me good!

name: Robert Tatum
text: Friendly stylists, great prices, and no long waits thanks to online check-in ✔

name: Sarah Routzong
text:
I made an appointment for  11:00 a.m., three days in advance, for a cut, blow out and style.  Well, I was running a few minutes late this morning, seeing as I have an infant to care for and showed up at exactly 11:03 a.m.  My stylist, whom is also the MANAGER told me she went ahead and took a walk-in because I was ALMOST five minutes late.  By now, it is 11:04.  After this, she tells me she "may"have time to squeeze in a cut, blow dry and style.  I waited until 11:22 to have my hair done and styled poorly.  Needless to say, I will not be making another appointment at Cost Cutters ever again.

P.S. Cost Cutters...If you want to build a solid customer base, consider being respectful to your future clients.  Peace.

text: Went today & ended up leaving. The chick with the pink hair was scatter brained ("n'stuff") & obviously did not care that we were waiting. She took her time & tended to other unimportant things as we sat and waited in disbelief that she had no respect for our time. Even after an hour, we decided if those people had such little respect for us we weren't going to trust them with my 10 year old sons hair. I wouldn't even give them one star. A complete waste of our time. There must be a real adult responsible for this business & I hope they know they let airheads run it.

text: I have tried several different places and Cost Cutters being one. I have tried Cost Cutters beside Publix twice and have been very disappointed in the customer service and the quality of the cut. They did not provide a rinse after my haircut therefore, I had to spend the rest of my day in Dothan with hair down my shirt. The straw that broke the camel's back was the last time, I went in Cost Cutters they literally cut my hair in 5 minutes and my sideburns were uneven. I asked the beautician about this and she said that they looked fine to her. When I got home I had to straighten my sideburns with Clippers myself. I will not be going back.

text:
I had the same experience as “Blossom Baby”, my masseur stayed on her phone the whole time and I received a one handed massage...I don’t recommend it, so please make sure Marcy/Marcie is not providing your service before you go.
However, my sister received her facial from Jonathan and he was fantastic! I just cannot rate them higher than one star as long as I know there are unsuspecting clients who may be receiving one handed massages from Marcy. I have received 3 other massages from other masseurs there over the years and they were great, but Marcy was enough to make me not want to try again.

resp.text: Awesome! We're glad you enjoyed the massage! Please come again soon.

name: Diam0nd Sakura
text: I have been to the Spa a few times and its different every time. I actually had a someone fall asleep while massaging me, I also had one that kept stopping to text on her phone. I should have reported them when I had the chance, but I hope they are gone. I had facial for the first time and it was awesome.

name: Eric Hendrix
text:
$25 for a day pass.  The guy who checked me in was useless.  Collected my money and said ok, you can go back.  No tour, no explaining where everything was...nothing.  It’s rather small so I was able to figure out the lockers and get into my robe rather quickly and head straight for the steam room.

Surprise, the steam room is broken down.  That sucks, but I could still do the sauna and whirlpool.  Wrong, sauna is broken too.  So all you get for your $25 is a whirlpool, and a lounge that has cartoons blasting loudly on the TV for some reason.

I am usually one to just write off a bad experience and say lesson learned but I did go back out front and talk to the girl at the desk.  She was very apologetic and said they should have told me about the steam room, and she had no idea that the sauna was broken.  She refunded my money and I left.

It has potential but this place is terrible right now.

name: Roger Prodacter
text: There needs to be signs posted in the spa that say that swimsuits must be worn at all times in the spa area. It's not sanitary to have naked people using the whirlpool or sauna/steam room.

text: This was my second time coming to Sugarmoon, the first visit was great and everyone I encountered was very friendly and professional. Today I didn't feel welcomed at all. The person who checked me in didn't as much as say hello. She asked me my name took me to the room and then told me that they are out of towels because their dryer is broken, what kind of customer service is that? Also, they are offering a 30% discount for nurses but when I asked about getting the discount, I was told that I needed my badge as proof. I told them that I didn't have my badge but I did have my nursing license. I was told that they couldn't accept that because that was not proof that I am a nurse, how dumb is that. Then after getting home, I realized that I had a burn from the wax on one of my eyebrows, I thought I had found a good place to have all of my waxing services done, but I don't think that is the case. I guess I will have to look elsewhere to have them done.

name: Kathy Adcock
text: I love SugarMoon Studio. I have been waxing for years paying over $60 a month but SugarMoon Studio has an amazing offers for their clients. My first service with them was half off then follow ups every two weeks are only $35. I don’t hardly have any hairs at two weeks but this offer allows me to stay bare! I am so thankful I found SugarMoon Studio. The ladies are beyond amazing. Check them out.

name: Shaye Wingo
text: Love these ladies! Very professional, clean environment and always very welcoming when I come in. I highly recommend them.

name: Charnika Reynolds
text: I gave this location in Oxford a two because my second experience here was awful, painful, and sticky. My very first wax was done here a few months back by the lady who manages the Gasden location. It was an amazing experience. She made me comfortable, held on to sensitive areas as she pulled the sugar, and braced me when she was about to pull. Today was NOTHING LIKE THAT. Zoey is friendly, with a great personality, but extremely rough, heavy handed, and messy. I should have followed my first mind and drove to Gasden, but I figured it would be the same experience. I was so pleased my first time, I tipped  $25. I am a firm believer in tipping if there is an option to do so, but, I still have hair in between my cheeks, along with clumps of wax,  and a Brazilian is something that can't be rushed. I suggest the Gasden location if you're a first timer. I'll just drive to Birmingham from now on.The staff is great, just read reviews on the person you select or ask questions.

name: Nikia Hanba
text: Always enjoy the service that I receive at this salon. Jerica always does an awesome job on my color and style. Love the personal service I receive and the conversations! I recommend them all the time!

name: Dkhaired Angel
text:
I went into the salon and asked for a haircut.   The advertised price was $12.95 w/ shampoo.   I was taken to a chair and doused with a spray bottle of water, and given a haircut!  I was sent out the door with semi wet hair and no offer to style what so ever!  In my opinion this is unprofessional.   Being a retired hairstylist I would never have let my client walk into my salon and not shampoo the hair and make an offer of a style to my client.   As a client I shouldn't have to beg or request a service that is offered for a set price, this is pure laziness.

My cut was good but you would never know it from the way my hair looked when I left the salon.   I certainly wasn't a very good advertisement for this stylist or the salon!

name: Heather Craig
text: NEVER AGAIN WILL I GO. I got a hair cut from Ealissa and I absolutely HATE it! I specifically brought in a picture of what I wanted, and she turned me away from the mirror and basically cut my hair however she wanted with NO REGARD to the picture I brought in. My hair is literally 6" shorter than what I asked for, and when I told her that, NO APOLOGY. She basically told me that in the picture, the girl had extensions and that's why mine was so much shorter. And then said that it shrank because it was wet. She chopped all of it off without even asking anything. I cried for two hours. The boss was very nice, and refunded my money, but now I am stuck with a hair cut that I absolutely hate until it grows out. There's also a HUGE gap in the back where she cut part shorter than the rest. The point of the picture was so I could have the style and the length, and she completely did what she wanted. Every time I see all my hair gone, I cry again. I had waist length hair, and she cut it up to my jaw instead of below my collar bone. If I could give 0 stars I would. I could go on and on about how upset I am with what I ended up with, and the fact that Ealissa made NO EFFORT to fix her mistake.

name: Tina Brooks

name: MsCandysB
text: Absolutely horrible , run don't walk and go the other way. Went here to get my daughter's dead ends trimmed and the lady Alicia made my daughter look like Dora the explorer and she went in looking like Alicia Keys. Major difference slightly exaggerating about the Alicia Keys but my point is she said she cut an inch off because she only had about an inch of dead ends. She literally cut like 2 1/2 - 3 1/2 inches and I have the pics to prove it. So disappointed never again. We will never go here again. Not to mention the integrity issue my had straightened my daughters hair before coming in and she wet it after she was done so it curled up and was less noticeable about how much she had actually cut. My daughter has really tight curls straighten it's below her shoulder blades, curled shoulder length or a little longer now she literally looks like Dora.

text:
1 star only because zero is not an option, have given this location several chances. Was hoping since Shiloh was now the manager that it would be better. but no. There is an older lady and every time I have gone, she tells me she is too busy (when there is no one waiting) or that she won't have time to do a basic cut. Last night I got there at 5:55 (they close at 7:00). No customers in the chair or waiting. She appeared to be talking with friends in the back room. She never came around to the front of the salon. She only looked at me through the mirrors.  When she asked what I needed, (a basic kids cut) she told me it would be at least 30 mins. I asked is she could put our name on the list and I would go pick-up the Walmart items I needed first and she said no, that I could just check back with her in 30 mins.
I called the Jacksonville store that she immediately got us in even though she also had other people waiting.  Will continue to use Jacksonville but do not waste your time in Lenlock!!!!!

text:
Came in asked to get my hair dyed. The manager then asked me, what is one your head? It had been some times since I had dyed my hair. I explained that it had been box over 2 months. She then publicly proclaimed infornt of everyone, even getting in my face, I WILL not dye your hair. I will not put my name on your head because I have nothing to cover...that. the public thinks they can just do whatever to their hair. I wont do it.
Embarrased and upset I left. I was shocked to learn that stylist DO infact dye hair that has been boxed and will even fix a mess up.
I do not recommend this salon! Lord knows if the manager acts like this what a joke her staff must be!

name: Leslie Ann
text: I will never go here ever again!! I recommend no body to go here. First of all I have long hair, I wanted my split ends off and layered along with face layered. All she did was a face layered and split ends, and then she took a big round tool for the hair dryer and tried to curl up my hair, when I got home, my husband looked and they burned some of my hair so not only was my hair the same, just a snip here and there, but it stayed frizzy all the time, no matter what I did it would still frizzy. So I finally went to options in my town and they did my hair right. My mom went the same day I had mine done at Walmart, this same place. The girl who did hers, was suppose to cut her split ends off and layer it. She did 2 snips on 1 side and the other side and she was done. Then they changed their prices from 15$ (for a wash and cut along with druing) to 20$ for a wash, cut and dry. It's still 15$ for a cut and wash, but you will have to go around with wet hair because in order to dry, you have to pay 5$ more. Oh but they don't tell you that at the counter BTW!! Wound up paying almost 45$ for mine and my mom's hair cuts. They would not refund either. So I could have let my 10yr old niece cut my hair way better than those people and saved 45$. I will never go back. I suggest to anyone else, if you want to goto your salon who does a good job, but decides oh I'm at Walmart, I'll just do it here, don't! Go ahead make an appointment or walk in at your fav salon. Save your money.

text: The best place around for hair color,  cut,  style,  perms and Brazilian blowouts.  Large selection of Paul Mitchell products and other products.

name: Linda Marshall
text: I was desperate for a color correction and overall hair makeover. After checking out their reviews, I chose Kreative Kuts. I am happy to say that my experience was absolutely wonderful!!' Kim took sincere time with me to choose a color, style and introduced me to several new things that I had not heard of. I decided to do the Brazilian blowout at the time of my color and cut. She patiently and joyfully worked on my LONG hair for hours even staying late to give me the most amazing hair I've had!!  She never rushed or cut any corners to hurry, she continued to take time and make certain that everything was done correctly. I am so excited to have a new do and a new hair stylist. She is definitely a color specialist and the entire staff was very professional, qualified, talented as well as friendly. They can do eyelash perms, Brazilian blowout, and sell all the fine Paul Mitchell products, not to mention, new and interesting tools. I give them a 10 plus!!! Oh and the other great part was the price, they were so reasonable for the services they perform and their main goal is to make sure you are completely satisfied when you leave!! Thank you Kim and P.J and I will see you again in August!!!!

name: Austin Andrews

text: Great place to get a haircut!! Kim is the best, go see her.

name: Angela Anderson
text: Nice clean friendly environment and  Reasonably priced

name: Jamie Perry
text: My whole family goes to Creative Kuts & Styles Hair Salon and Beauty Shop. My Mum and I love that the hairdressers go to the Nashville and other hair shows to learn how to do the latest cuts, colors and styles (my Dad and brother don't care as much - they just get the same men's barber hair cut each time). I worked at a beauty parlor years ago and I can tell you that I've never seen hair stylists or beauticians that care as much as Kim and her team. I have very long hair that I dread cutting but the girls take off only what is necessary. I alternate between hair straightening and letting the  hairdressing salon tame it all perfectly into loose wavy curls. Every six weeks I like to get a deep conditioning keratin treatment and multidimensional highlights and Kim is the best at listening to and giving me exactly what I want. I love that I can buy all of my fav Paul Mitchell, A.R.C.O.N and Olez hair and beauty supplies here too. For Mothers Day, I treated my Mom to some corrective hair coloring (these guys are master colorists) and a new textured bob that she absolutely adores and a relaxing pedicure too. We have booked them to do all the hair updos for my bridal party in mid-June. I've seen some of their wedding hairstyles on instagram and am so excited.

name: Patti Neal
text: Good experience

name: Kylie Wilborn
text: Hunter Terry is awesome!!

name: Sharlene Moore
text: Marissa is the best stylist for my hair style. She is personable and knows how cut long layers. Her salon is always clean when I have my appointment.

name: emily horne
text: Katie Bain at Society Salon does an amazing job! Everyone in the salon is nice and professional and it is very clean!

name: Erika B
text: My desired red hair color was achieved! It turned out amazing! I just didn't know it was gonna cost $600 to achieve it. I didn't have that much on me either.  Next time I'm going to ask more questions or it should be brought up on how much it could be. I'm no stylist so I don't know the cost and steps you have to take. That's why I called ahead of time..I was told $51, depending on how much color. I think it needs to be estimated while you're explaining how you want it. Other Salons told me I was Overcharged! And it should've been $350 MAX and that is celebrity pricing.

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback, Erika. We're disappointed that your experience with us wasn't 100% enjoyable and that you had "sticker shock" at the end of your appointment! We coach our stylists and Guest Experience Experts up front on informing clients that we can't give completely set prices on color corrections as the service and products used usually changes throughout the time spent on the  correction. However, you should have definitely been updated and consulted THROUGHOUT the appointment to ensure you and your stylist were on the same page the whole time! We will talk to the appropriate members of our staff to ensure this doesn't happen again. We are glad you love the color - the pictures of it are absolutely gorgeous!

name: Danii Small
text: This was my first visit to Society Salon & I will definitely be returning. Emily was my stylist and she is really fun and energetic.  Conversation with her was easy and flowed naturally. She is young but has been a stylist for 2 years and her experience & knowledge really showed through the amazing job she did with my hair!

resp.text: Thank you so much Danii! We are so glad you enjoyed your time with Emily!

name: Erika Blaydes
text: The salon is Glamorous! Clean and professional! I will return, but with more salon price educated.I wanted to be a deep red color, and it was achieved in 3 hrs. The only thing that I found upsetting after I was sooo very 😊 with the hair, was the total! $600!! Now,  the total shouldn't be a mystery while you are getting it done. It should be discussed about how much it will be when you are describing what you want to the stylist while she is evaluating your hair. And if its too high, then a different affordable approach. I'm not educated in this field, so I have no idea what steps have to be taken or how much those steps are, such as the $150/ hr. that I was charged. I was told differently on the appt. call. That was all the cash I had, barely enough to tip😒. So if the stylist want great tips, then make your clients more aware of the style price so they bring enough money.

resp.text: We appreciate the feedback, Erika. We're disappointed that your experience with us wasn't 100% enjoyable and that you had "sticker shock" at the end of your appointment! We coach our stylists and Guest Experience Experts up front on informing clients that we can't give completely set prices on color corrections as the service and products used usually changes throughout the time spent on the  correction. However, you should have definitely been updated and consulted THROUGHOUT the appointment to ensure you and your stylist were on the same page the whole time! We will talk to the appropriate members of our staff to ensure this doesn't happen again. We are glad you love the color - the pictures of it are absolutely gorgeous!

resp.text:
Fiona, thank you so much for your feedback. I’m sorry to hear that you are not satisfied with the service you received within our salon. I see that you did already book your next appointment with the same stylist but since it is within two weeks of your initial appointment, we would love for you to come in and allow us to make any changes at our cost that would make you love your hair. Please give us a call today at 256-665-3651 and ask to speak to Lauren, our manager. She will get you set up for an appointment sooner than your one scheduled in May. Thank you!

Edit: I talked to your stylist and front desk today regarding your initial appointment - I was informed that you were unable to receive your full ombré due to arriving very late to your appointment, therefore the stylist did not have enough time to do a full ombré for you. Unfortunately, When our application time is shortened due to the late arrival of the client - we have to alter the service.

name: Oneal Thomas
text: Not the best customer service, my sister came in to get her lashes done. Was promised that she wouldn't be charged for lash removal services since she only had about four or five lashes on at the time. She got there and after getting her lashes done they charged her even though they promised her before booking the appointment that she wouldn't be charged! plus her lashes didn't last long. She's not going public with this because of her high status in her company, but I'm glad people like me and her friends can express her disappointment in this company.

resp.text:
Hey Oneal. Please have your sister contact us directly. Every lash removal is charged for a lash removal. There has never been a time when our lash artists have approved not being paid for their time to remove a client’s lashes. I would like to speak with her so I can find out who misconstrued that information to her to cause such confusion as both of our Guest Experience Experts that handle scheduling, know that it is a service that always costs since it requires proper training and techniques to not compromise the client’s natural lashes.

There a multitude of factors that go into lashes not lasting long. And in this case, your sister, I’ll withhold her name too for the reasoning you stated, was informed for the beginning that she had short natural lashes - and going as long as she wanted to go could lessen the amount of time they would last. Getting them wet at all within 24 hours and proper at home protocols not being followed will also shorten the time.

All of this is explained at the appointment as well as some of it is notated on the waiver signed in the beginning of the appointment.

Again, please have your sister contact us directly so we discuss ways we can properly rectify this situation with her. Thanks!

***edited to add: I see she was already refunded a FULL refund for her full set 4 days ago. I’m not sure what else we can do to rectify this situation more than we have. I would still like to hear from her though who originally told her there would be no charge. Thank you

Or have her be the one to leave the review so we can be in direct contact with her. We always stand behind our work when proper at home maintenance is followed as well as when the take home products that are recommended at every new lash appointment are being used. Please have your friend reach out to use so we can help her.

name: Tofu McNooch
text:
The entire staff here is great. No one has a big ego, and they support and assist each other to make sure clients get what they want. Jen FIXXXEDDD my hair. I have very long hair that I tried to dye myself, light brown to ginger red. Big mistake. Hot roots, a total mess. I lived out of state and went to a local salon to fix it. They made it look more even and it improved, but it still wasn't the color I wanted. I moved here and found New Look. Jen really took the time to get my color exactly how I wanted it. It was a long salon day, with deep conditioning, all-over lightening, and a toner that made it perfect. I wanted a bright, orange-y/copper, natural ginger look. SHE.DID. IT. All of this was done WITHOUT damaging my hair--and it was a pretty drastic change. I've had my hair lightened before, and there was always a period of super-dry, frizzy straw hair that took weeks of deep conditioning to recuperate. This is not the case now. My hair doesn't even feel like it's been colored at all. It's just as healthy as it was from the start. Also, I now get complements on my hair E-V-E-R-Y day. That's never happened to me before! It's in the name, y'all: New Look.

If you're looking to srrsly upgrade your hair, go here.

text: I scheduled an appointment for 4pm. I walked in a few minutes early and she asked me to come back in an hour when she'd be done with a clients hair she was working on. I said sure, no problem and came back at 4:50 or so. A mother and two daughters walked in right in front of me and the owner said she was going to cut her hair first then get to me afterwards. I sat down for a minute then realized after she started washing the girls hair that I'd sit there for at least another 1.5 hrs. There was no apology, no offer to reschedule, nothing. Worst lack of consideration for customer service I've ever had.

resp.text:
We personally apologize for making you feeling that way. It was not our intentions.
Sincerely,  New Look Hair Salon

name: Jada Jones
text:
I’m posting this on behalf of my friend who I took to Lavish as of July 27, 2020. She went in for eyebrow waxing, natural eyelash extension and eyebrow tinting. In the photo that’s been posted you can clearly see how uneven her brows are. It’s ridiculous that you pay this much money and you receive these types of results. I will never go back to this place. If you’re reading this please take this as a warning not to go to this place and spend your money. She wasted $50 dollars for her poor service.

Update: The woman who did the job called my friend and asked us why I gave them a poor review. She said she could’ve easily fixed it. You were the one doing her eyebrows. If you would’ve looked at your work you would’ve seen the job that you did was sloppy. You didn’t care. The only reason that you care now is because you have a recent bad review. If you could’ve easily fixed it, it should’ve been done before we left and paid.

name: Cami T
text: I’ve been going here for a while now to have my eyebrows threaded. I’ve always had really good experiences until today. Nobody here ever tried to do anything more than clean up my eyebrows, and they always looked tidy and great. But today, half of each eyebrow was threaded off it seems like. My eyebrows have never been as thin as they are now, and I’ve been having my brows done for around 10 or so years. I just hope they grow back and SOON. And the next time they need cleaning up, I’ll be finding somewhere else to have that done.

name: Maria Reagin
text:
Although the ladies were friendly enough at least one them from start to finish not so much on the lash lady near the end. Reason for one star...

The services I asked for and what I actually received in turn was not good at all. I went in for a facial threading, wax, and lash extensions yet when I went home and looked at the work done via my closeup magnifying mirror I saw lots of hair still on my face and many missed hairs on my mustache area despite being plucked as well, so attention to detail definitely royally lacking in this area.
Now, the service on my lashes was actually even worse. I went in with a picture of what style and length of lashes I was wanting and instead I left with the complete opposite as the so-called technician had admitted that she decided to go a couple of sizes up on length despite what I had requested, as well, she had missed some areas where there were gaps and so I asked for those areas to be filled and lashes trimmed since they were too long (not what I asked for), although she claimed she fixed them, NOT, I was treated with frustration and impatience after the touch up I asked for to the point that she left me in the room and didn't come back to check on me or say anything, she just went out and took another customer which clearly expressed to me that she was done with me despite the fact that she didn't do what I had asked for but instead what she wanted to do. And, after looking closer at them when I got home thru my magnifying mirror they looked horrid as all the glue was visible (not black glue) and stuck to many of the lashes which caused them to clump together and they were still too long. I really tried to deal with them, followed all the instructions (that by the way I was told upon leaving to take a picture of from their taped sheet on a mirror, really!), the best that I could but the length of them was just not natural looking to my face and the horrid clumped up lashes was just to much to deal with, SO, so disappointing.  It was even obvious by every one's look on their face when they saw me and some clearly said so. I finally had to have them carefully removed the next week. I WILL NEVER EVER, EVER RETURN TO THIS PLACE NOR WOULD I EVER RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE I KNOW, and I am not one to give bad reviews but in this case there was just too much of the bad to go around, just shameful! ☹😞😣😟...

text:
Ashley is my wax specialist at the Birmingham location and she's amazing.  She's been doing my wax for about 5-6 months.  She does a great job and is super friendly and professional.  Highly recommend her and EWC.
I've been a customer of EWC since around 2016/2017 when I moved to the Gulf Coast area and had to find a new wax place since I had previously used a locally owned wax spa in Birmingham.  While living on the Gulf Coast, I patronized the New Orleans, LA, Diberville, MS, and Slidell, LA EWC locations.
The Slidell, LA and Birmingham locations are the best locations of the four I've tried.  I've been getting a full Brazilian bikini wax for 10-11 years now so I know a great wax specialist when I find one...And if you're wondering, yes, I have a wax pass.  Applicable service: Full Brazilian Bikini Wax.

name: Danesha Clarke
text:
I booked a Saturday appointment with European Wax Center on Thursday. In order to travel I need a Covid test which was also booked for Saturday.
I got tested that morning but waiting on the results was going to make the appointment difficult to make. Realizing this, I called to ask if the time could be pushed back; they were booked and said it could not be changed.
We got the results in enough time for me to make the appointment. I called to say that I was on my way and the person on the phone told me the waxer was uncomfortable waxing me.
I let her know that the covid test was a requirement for travel and I had not been in contact with anyone with covid and already received the negative result.

She then said they usually don't come back that quickly, and would have to reschedule.

I understand taking precautions, but I had just recieved a negative result. It's also likely that persons with Covid-19 are actively patronizing their location.
However,  because they were aware that I took the test I was unable to go to my appointment. Very disappointing.

text: I set up an appointment for both me and my sister. That process was great I received a call the day of to tell me that the first person we were scheduled to see had canceled but that was no problem because they set me up with Someone else. Then as I’m driving from a long distance from where I stay. I received a call saying that the other person we were scheduled with could not do it and if we did come they could try and if she was to do it she could only do one. But overall it’s not guaranteed. So I go into the center to cancel the appointment since I was already in the area to and the receptionist made no eye contact or let me know that everything was canceled. I had to ask her was it completed. She didn’t even say have a good day. She was a black girl with short hair. We stay about 45 minutes away and came together. The appointments was at 2:30 and 3:00. We are first time guest and We will not be coming back.

If you are willing to give us another chance, please reach out to us at (205) 637-3201 to speak to our manager directly. Thank you again for taking the time to let us know how we can improve. We hope you will consider us again in the future. Take care.

text: Would recommend to others. Today was my 3rd visit. Each time the staff has taken their time to explain the procedures while making me feel at ease.

text: They kept switching my wax appointment over the course of a week, which was fine, and the day of they switched it again because one girl had an emergency. Then 45 minutes before they cancelled it because of another “emergency”. I booked my first appointment 1.5 months before because I needed it done this one day. Very unprofessional and I will never book her again.

name: Jamecia Minter
text:
Adrian was amazing! I was so comfortable with her immediately as a first time guest, she answered all of the questions I had and she was extremely knowledgeable about every product and tips for first time waxers! Definitely give her a try, she won’t disappoint. 🖤

Also, the girls at the front desk were amazing and very kind!

name: Anita Sims
text: After 8 months of no waxing I drove from Montgomery for a Brazilian wax. Adrian was my wax specialist and she was the best. She gave me tips on care for my Brazilian wax and just made the experience comfortable.The Smooth Me and the new exfoliating scrub is LIFE! Definitely sticking with Adrian.

name: Jasmine Madden
text: Good

resp.text: Hi Jasmine! We love having you at our center and are happy to hear you had a great experience. See you soon!

name: Shelby Sandlin
text: Had been using this place for a while because they were the only ones around using hard wax. The last 2 experiences have been more than disappointing. So many hairs left and the last 2 times I have been burned bad enough for the burn to last a week. Called to let them know and was told the manager would call me about getting my money back. Still haven't heard from them. Don't go here. Go to LA Bikini. They charge to much at EWC for a half done job.

name: Crystal Parker
text: I just wanted to comment on yet another wonderful experience I had last weekend (11/18/2017). Lindsey took great care of me and she made sure I left satisfied. She is personable and efficient; I couldn't ask for anyone any better!

name: Corinna Bass
text:
I got a free wax from the Southern Women's Show from European Wax Center.  I called to make an appointment and was in the same day!  Doug Baker Blvd is definitely all the way down Hwy 280 from where I live in Homewood, however, the clean space I walked into was worth the drive!
The whole place is very streamlined and beautiful.   The products are beautifully displayed on the wall along with descriptions.
The receptionist was a very informative, sweet young lady that even gave me free samples when I showed interest, but did not purchase that day, which I loved!  (Some places feel "pushy" but here, I was very comfortable and left feeling pampered.)
The best part is, if you have never been, you can receive a free wax, and I love 'trying before buying!'
Tell them Corinna sent you!

resp.text: Hi Corinna! We love having you at our center and are happy to hear you had a great experience. See you soon!

name: Molly Johnson
text: Had a fantastic appointment with Amaryllis today and couldn’t be more satisfied. As an esthetician myself, I immediately worried about everything that could go wrong. She knows what she’s doing and she’s very personable. As a waxer myself, I know how important it is to be funny and have good conversation during such a long and intimate wax. So it was comfortable and great! I hate waxing myself so Amaryllis will definitely be my new go-to! No more doing acrobatics to try and wax myself!

resp.text: Molly, thank you so much for the positive review! We hope you have a great day!

name: Burthia Booker
text: Great service, both in front and in back. Clean, quick and efficient. I super appreciate this spot every time I go!

resp.text: Burthia, we are so happy to read such a great review about European Wax Center! Thank you again for letting our team know how we did! We look forward to helping again in the future. Take care!

name: Quantoria Beverly
text: Adrian was my waxer and she’s great, but she no longer work with the company. Another person did my wax today and I had hairs left and wax left on me in several places. Now I have to go back Monday to get a touch up. There service have gone down hill and I pay entirely too much to have to come back. I think this is a little ridiculous. They should compensate you in some other way. I’m considering not coming back once my wax pass is finished. Will not be renewing unless my last wax with my pass is 100% flawless.

Facilities are clean and seems well kept but extremely cold and Dr office like. Not  inviting and comfortable. Keep looking.

name: Asia Alfred
text: Wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone!! The receptionist wasn’t the friendliest and the lady next to her seemed to have an attitude. I feel like if I’m spending my money here then I should at least get decent service WITHOUT attitude. Not to mention the lady who did my service acted as though she didn’t know what she was doing! Never again will I waste my money at this unprofessional place.

resp.text: Thank you for being a valued guest of European Wax Center. I'm sorry to hear about your experience in our Birmingham-Greystone location and appreciate you taking the time to make us aware of the situation. I'm so sorry to hear of your unsatisfied visit and would like to speak with you so we can discuss your experience in more detail. Our guest's satisfaction is very important to us, and we'll do our best to rectify the situation and better your experience moving forward. Please reach out to me at 205-637-3201 or direct message me with your contact info, and I'll be happy to contact you.

name: large marge
text:
I’ve been going to this location for over a year (EWC customer in other states since 2012) and I’ve never had a problem. Etoria is my waxer and she’s the best I’ve had. She’s professional, friendly, and makes you feel comfortable.

The waxer I use now is Abbey and she's great!

resp.text: Hi there. Thanks for reaching out! We are thrilled to hear that you had a great experience with Etoria and Abbey. Have a great day!

name: Chasity Pouge
text: I used to rave about this place but lately it has not been the best experience. The turnover is high which is bad enough but they will cancel your appointment at the last minute and then when I came in for my new rescheduled appointment I wasn’t even acknowledged by the receptionists. Yes plural because there was 2.  The usual receptionist knows me by face so I guess I didn’t think nothing of it when those two said nothing to me since they seemed preoccupied...one with another customer and the other took a call on her cell and stepped away. I waited 30 mins to find out that my rescheduled appointment needed to be cancelled because the tech had a family emergency and she left. Walked right pass me!  I finally got to my breaking point and acknowledged the 2 ladies and they had no excuses that made any sense. One of them said she thought I was someone else so I guess we all look alike to her but ok and the other one said with all honesty she simply said you are right we said nothing to you. She was the one who took the call on her cell. Ok so the only wax tech that was still there had I guess turned her wax up and said she could wax me but I needed to give her wax time to cool or I could reschedule again. I opted to wait another 15 mins to let it cool. I must say she was good and this my first time with her but she was actually super nice and I apologized for getting rowdy to her that is just how good she was. As I was leaving the 2 ladies in the front wanted to offer me something for my inconvenience but I got prepaid wax passes so there no credit that could be given so they opted to give me samples which I took cause no one has ever given me samples at this place. It’s sample though so I dunno if that is something spectacular. I asked for a number for management and they said that the manager would have to call me. That’s been a month ago and no call but my $121 pre paid wax pass payment just hit my card again today.  I see that isn’t being rescheduled!  So I said all this to say I might be calling the number and asking for a manager again and getting funds reversed because I can not keep coming to a sinking ship.  Maybe I will do a dispute with my bank and bypass trying to talk to anyone since I never got that call to begin with.

resp.text: Chasity Pouge, we regret to hear that you had a negative experience with us, but would appreciate the chance to turn your experience around. Thanks for bringing this matter to our attention. We would like to get more details about this; please reach out to us at your earliest convenience at  205.637.32.01.

name: Caitlin Carson
text:
DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY! Awkward ...overpriced and unsure of the experience of the technician (this place charges twice the going rate in our area and the service is not half as good as the other places!)

When I arrived the check in process was a little intrusive. The girl at the front desk wanted to see my driver’s license? I’ve been to several spas and had many waxes and never have been asked for a copy of my drivers license. That seems a little extreme for a spa service? But okay. I go to the restroom before my appt starts and when I’m walking back to the waiting area someone calls out my name from a room ..It was my technician (first visit at this place and don’t remember her name)? I felt like that was forward (but not so much so that it ruined the appt). However, then I step into my room and the technician tells me to undress from the waist down that she will do my brows first then my Brazillian ?!? So I don’t have a choice in this and have to lay there EXPOSED while my brows are being done?!? Not only that she didn’t go anywhere! She did not leave the room for me to undress and just stayed in there!?! That’s not typical. Every place I’ve ever been (and I’ve been to many saloons and spas) has always left me in the room to undress then they would come in. More so  than that I’m usually given something to cover up with until the service is needed in that area (unless it’s just a Brazillian that we go straight to). I did not like that!! It was strange and the technician didn’t say a word while she was working which makes things even more awkward!! Oh except for the “shave shaming” as if that’s the reason for the horrible pain that I feel when my hair is being ripped out of my skin around my pubic bone! Lol ?!? So the technician had a dry personality (looking back she seemed weird) ..I had to lay on the table exposed while my brows were getting done first (I didn’t have a choice in that or wasn’t told I did). Also, she stays in the room while I change!!! And when it’s over she stays in the room waiting for me to get dressed!! There was absolutely no concern for privacy or customary respect and boundaries. I much prefer the other place that I go (Marci’s Hoover). The prices are better. The experience isn’t creepy weird or demeaning and my technician is friendly and speaks!

Oh and heads up anyone who gets a brow wax, the technician removed all of my make up then waxed my brows! I told her that I prefer that she just get the strays outside of my make up. My brows are thinning and I have a particular shape that I prefer! That was not respected at all!! There is NO need to remove the make up first of all. (That’s just some personal preference of the technician). That should be the clients choice! We should be able to change without someone watching us when we arrive and before we leave!! There’s no way this place will stay around much longer if things don’t change! Why would anyone continue to pay twice the price for a worse experience!? It’s a strip mall wax place just like Marci’s ..only they advertise like it’s some type of luxury saloon. It’s not..thank goodness they didn’t try to sell me products or some membership. I hate it when I’m paying for a service and still being subjected to high pressure sales. So that is a bonus. To add to the bad experience my wax took close to 30 minutes! It’s never taken that long anywhere else. I don’t think the technician was very experienced. I also felt it was a little creepy that she didn’t say much at all but that she just stays in the room while I’m changing out and back into my clothes. When I was leaving I felt rushed, she was standing with her hand in the door watching me put my shoes on!! I felt rushed cuz her next appt was there! I mean give a a girl some space!

To the management: you need to take note of the things I’ve said. The only people  who wouldn’t be bothered by those things likely don’t know any better and probably haven’t been to other saloons.

resp.text: Our manager would really like to speak with you more regarding this matter. Please reach out to us at (205) 637-3201. We look forward to hearing from you.

There were little places where you could tell more hair was pulled. I personally was just not satisfied and have gotten better eyebrow waxing from nail salons for 15 dollars. I geuss the experience all depends on the person who does it.

There wasn't anyone at the front desk so we took a seat - some people were in the back and noticed us but didn't say anything to us. Then I guess the front desk girl got back with some ice cream or something and that's when we found out they only take appointments(?) and even though they're still open for an hour and everyone is just chilling in the back talking there's just absolutely no way possible to fit us in for anything. It would have been understandable if she wasn't basically laughing at us for asking.

text:
I went in yesterday for a Brazillian wax. I've had many before at EWC, so I knew the kind of pain that I was in store for. I have sensitive skin and a low pain tolerance, so as always, I was very nervous.

However, yesterday's session was by far the best wax I've ever had. It was all thanks to the wax specialist, Lindsey.

She was the kindest, most encouraging woman I've ever had at EWC. Not only was she fast and did an excellent job, she made sure I was comfortable the entire time. She constantly asked, "Are you okay?" and said, "I'm so proud of you, you're doing so well!"

To say I was happy with the service is a complete understatement. I will definitely be asking for Lindsey every time I go to EWC, whether it's in Tuscaloosa or Birmingham.

Thank you, Lindsey!

Very sweet and definitely knows how to cut short hair. She razor cuts, point cuts, texturizes it big time. And all for $20 + tip. I’m telling you, the struggle is real and I’m so grateful to have found this gem!

text: I went for the first time to get a Brazilian wax, the woman was very friendly however I have had many Brazilian waxes other places that were great. She did give me some wax removal lotion to use but honestly it did not really work. I would not recommend this place for waxing as it seemed unprofessional and not to mention unclean. I would recommend European wax center over this place, much more professional, clean, and knowledgeable.

resp.text: Hi Lauren, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We're sorry to hear about your unpleasant experience at our salon. The satisfaction of our guest is our number one priority. Thank you to all the staff and especially Matthew.

text: Madison did my cut and color and she was the best!  Will definitely be returning and recommending.

name: michelle hall
text: I had a great facial at Ambiance. The atmosphere is very soothing and the staff was very helpful and nice. I also had a great shampoo and style afterwards. All the staff are professional and do a wonderful job. I highly recommend Ambiance Spalon and Massage Therapy to everyone....if you are tired of being treated like just another client, give these girls a try they will make you feel like one of the family

text: I always have great messages here! I actually have one scheduled soon and I can’t wait!

text:
had my  eyelashes tinted by the owner, What a GREAT job!  I've had this done at several other places many times but this one has lasted the longest.

Also a wonderful haircut & style by Coleen.  I had cancer and my hair was falling out she understood, gave me pointers and found a style that would work with me for a long time.

text:
While here on vacatoin,my sister n law and I went  for a massage and it was the worst experience I have ever had getting a massage,not relaxing at all. Matt was the  massage specialist.Not sure where or if he went to school but all I can say is ,it was awful. I've had  massages in California, Texas and Georgia and the people were great.
Do yourself a favor and don't get Matt.
Not sure if there are others at this place.

text:
had my  eyelashes tinted by the owner, What a GREAT job!  I've had this done at several other places many times but this one has lasted the longest.
